description.en: Common syndromes in family medicine. Risk groups, screening methods in family practice. Prevention and health promotion in family practice. Consultation in family practice, training of consultation skills. Management of problems in different age and gender groups. Community approach in family practice. Evidence-based approach in family practice.
description.et: Selekteerimata sümptomide probleemikeskse käsitlemise, riskirühmade väljaselgitamise ja ennetava ning profülaktilise tegevuse metoodika. Sagedasemad probleemid perearstiteaduses. Ambulatoorsete sissekannete metoodika. Epikriiside koostamine. Koduvisiitide metoodika. Perearsti suhtlemine patsientide ja teiste erialade arstidega. Konsultatsiooni metoodika. Perekonna käsitlus perearsti praktikas.

objectives.en: To introduce the management of different age and gender groups in primary health care, to elaborate communication skills with patients. To expand students'  understanding of an influence of a community and a family to an individual, and how to effectively prevent illnesses in a primary health care. To introduce the principles management of chronically ill patients in individual level but also in the level of the whole family.
objectives.et: Tutvustada üliõpilastele erinevate ea- ja soogruppide probleemikeskset käsitlemist perearsti praktikas, arendada üliõpilaste suhtlemisoskust patsientidega. Laiendada üliõpilaste arusaamu perekonna ja ühiskonna mõjust üksikindiviidi tervisele ja kuidas efektiivselt ennetada haiguste teket esmatasandi meditsiinis. Õpetada mitme samaaegse kroonilise haigusega patsiendi käsitlust nii üksikindiviidi kui ka perekonna aspektist lähtuvalt.

notes.et: University of Tartu suspended face-to face classes due to state of emergency and will continue as group-based e-learning in Moodle`i. Moodel`i e-course Family Medicine (ARPO.01.031) which includes materials,  individual homeworks. Deadlines and instructions are provided for submission. The subject ends with a final test in Moodle`i  which is opened for each group by the deadline. All study materials are included in the Moodle e-course.

independent_work.et:
Before coming to the seminar have to watch video lectures Moodle and prepare the tasks described in the seminar instructions.  

NB! Please see instructions for family medicine seminars 2018/2019. You can find the workshop instructions  the administration of study materials. 

Before seminar on "Male patient in family practice", please write an essay and do an independent work in Moodle e-learning environment.
Note: The independent task's instructions are added to the study materials. Please review the instructions.

grade_preconditions.et:
- At least 100% participation in the seminars.
- To presen in time all individual home-works.

grade_evaluation.et: Written test gives a maximum of 30 points.

debt_elimination.et: Debts must be eliminated upon individual agreement with the lecturer before the exam at the end of the semester. In the case of negative results in ordinary exams, the result can be improved during two repeat examinations.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Materials of lectures and workshops in 2nd year course on family medicine.
M.Bisconcin, G.Maso, N. Mathers. The European Textbook of Family Medicine Prevention and Health promotion page 67-96 (Chapter 1, Prevention and Health promotion) - view the material administration of study materials.
resources.recommended_materials:
1. S. Rollnick, WR Miller. CC. Butler. MOTIVATIONAL INTERVIEWING IN HEALTH CARE Helping Patients Change Behavior. The Guilford Press 2008. 
2. Silverman; Jonathan; Kurtz, Suzanne. (2013). Skills for Communicating with Patients, 3rd Edition. Taylor&Francis Group.
4. Taylor, R. (1994). Family Medicine.
5.Pendleton, D., Schofield, T., Tate, P. & Havelock, P. (1996) The Consultation - an approach to learning and teaching.

description.et: Video Lecture : Evidence-based prevention in family practice- possibilities and challenges - prof R. Kalda (lectures will be conducted Moodle)
Video Lecture : Patients with multimorbidity and medically unexplained physical symptoms - prof R. Kalda (lectures will be conducted Moodle)
Video Lecture: Making a diagnosis in primary care -  kaasprofessor M. Oona (lectures will be conducted Moodle)
Video Lecture: Health need assessment in primary care -  kaasprofessor M. Oona  (lectures will be conducted Moodle)
Video Lecture: Caring for children in family medicine -  kaasprofessor M. Oona (lectures will be conducted Moodle)

Elderly patients at family doctor center -   lektor T. Loogus

Caring for children in family medicine - kaasprofessor M. Oona

VISIT TO THE FAMILY MEDICAL CENTER takes place for each group and student at a specific time according to the appointment time of the family doctor. Information added to the Moodle e-course. In the e-course, you can find your family doctor's center with the date and time in the doctor's visit table. You will be in the center for the 4th hour.
